active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the trade-offs between frequent backups (high availability but increased storage costs) and less frequent backups (lower costs but higher risk of data loss). Reference how CP-9 addresses CIA protections and provide real-world examples from ransomware incidents.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5 CP-9 System Backup. Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security Architecture And Engineering > Information System Lifecycle > Incident Response and Recovery > Contingency Planning (CP Family) > System Backup (CP-9). Use the provided learning objectives (Bloom's Taxonomy), active learning components, 4 scaffolding layers, and flashcard schema to generate 50 high-quality flashcards. Incorporate: - Foundation from Layer 1 (definitions, CIA, prerequisites like CP Family basics). - Components from Layer 2 (CP-9 elements, NIST CSF PR.DS-11, concept map relationships). - Implementation from Layer 3 (procedures, tools, testing). - Integration from Layer 4 (RC/PR functions, immutable backups, cross-links to IR/CP-10). Objectives: [INSERT learning_objectives array]. Active Learning: [INSERT active_learning object]. Scaffolding: [INSERT scaffolding_layers array]. Schema: [INSERT flashcard_schema object]. Output ONLY in JSON: {'flashcards': [{'id':1, 'bloom_level':'REMEMBER', 'layer':'1', 'front':'...', 'back':{'answer':'...', 'explanation':'...', 'hints':['...']}, 'type':'MCQ' | 'open', 'options':['A:...','B:...'] if MCQ}, ...]}. Ensure distractors follow protocol, explanations reference sources (e.g., NIST links), and coverage spans all layers/objectives evenly. Make engaging for university-level learners with measurable, active recall.
